Class Utils

java.lang.Object
  Utils

public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides some static utility functions for working with resources (to avoid having to look up all the messy details). Resources are stored somewhere on the class path, usually in their own package. They are located by paths to files, such as "resources/images/mandelbrot.jpeg".

Constructor Detail

Utils

public Utils()
Method Detail

getImageResource

public static java.awt.Image getImageResource(java.lang.String pathToResource)
Load an image resource. In this case, the data will actually be read into memory only when the Image is first drawn.

Parameters:
pathToResource - the path to the resource.
Returns:
the image, or null if the resource can't be located.

getBufferedImageResource

public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBufferedImageResource(java.lang.String pathToResource)
Load a buffered image from a resource. In this case, the method does not return until the image data has been read and stored in memory.

Parameters:
pathToResource - the path to the resource.
Returns:
the image, or null if the resource can't be loaded.

iconFromResource

public static javax.swing.ImageIcon iconFromResource(java.lang.String pathToResource)
Create an ImageIcon from an image that is stored as a resource.

Parameters:
pathToResource - the path to the resource.
Returns:
the ImageIcon, or null if the resource can't be located.

playSoundResource

public static void playSoundResource(java.lang.String pathToResource)
Play a sound that is stored as a resource file. If the resource can't be located or can't be played, no sound is played, and no exception is thrown.

Parameters:
pathToResource - the path to the resource.

getSound

public static java.applet.AudioClip getSound(java.lang.String pathToResource)
Load an AudioClip from a resource file. The clip can be played by calling its play() method.

Parameters:
pathToResource - the path to the resource.
Returns:
the audio clip, or null if the resource can't be loaded.

createImageCursor

public static java.awt.Cursor createImageCursor(java.awt.Image image)
Create a cursor from an image, with hot point at the upper left corner (0,0).

Parameters:
image - the image; can't be null.
Returns:
a cursor that will show the image.

createImageCursor

public static java.awt.Cursor createImageCursor(java.lang.String pathToResource)
Create a cursor from an image resource file, with hot point at the upper left corner (0,0).

Parameters:
pathToResource - the path to the resource.
Returns:
the cursor or, if the resource can't be loaded, the default cursor.

createImageCursor

public static java.awt.Cursor createImageCursor(java.lang.String pathToResource,
                                                int hotSpotX,
                                                int hotSpotY)
Create a cursor from a resource file, with hot point at (hotSpotX, hotSpotY).

Parameters:
pathToResource - the path to the resource.
Returns:
a cursor that will show the image.

createImageCursor

public static java.awt.Cursor createImageCursor(java.awt.Image image,
                                                int hotSpotX,
                                                int hotSpotY)
Create a cursor from an image, with hot point at (hotSpotX, hotSpotY).

Parameters:
image - the image; can't be null.
Returns:
a cursor that will show the image.
